WRITING.TEXT: Hi! I lived in Aix last year for study abroad and went to universit #233; aix marseille. apartments are really expensive, but there is also a ton of student housing very close to campus. let me know if you have any questions about american life in aix, it #8217;s really a lovely city :)

WRITING.TITLE: Versailles Anyone?
WRITING.TEXT: Salut TAPIFers! Just wanted to see if any of you got placed in acad #233;mie Versailles. Also, anyone have updates about when we #8217;ll get our arr #234;tes, when to apply for visas, specific school, etc? I #8217;m getting super anxious waiting and haven #8217;t gotten a response from Erin yet.
Did you guys use fieldprint? Also did it cost $50?

When I studied abroad i was able to get several months worth of birth control pills to take with me, but my insurance would not cover the rest. I had three more months mailed to me from the states, and honestly i had no issues with it. It just took a long time to arrive.
date a man

I lived there for a semester studying abroad last fall :) it was honestly the time of my life lol i miss it. it #8217;s really expensive but a lovely city and a great place to br immersed in authentic french culture and language. i studied at universit #233; aix-marseille and i also danced with a ballet company there called Ballet Preljocaj. It #8217;s a great place for artists and dancers alike!

hey there! there is a whatsapp group :) i #8217;ll see if i can get a link for you! as of today only some people in primaire have gotten their placements, and nobody has received a stamped arr #234;t #233;. some europeans officially received their arr #234;t #233;s today, because they dont need the stamp. https://chat.whatsapp.com/DBNnrdIBDVF3Y1g6PH0E6x

WRITING.TITLE: Dancers?
WRITING.TEXT: Are there any fellow dancers participating in tapif or alumn dancers? I #8217;m worried that wherever I get placed I won #8217;t be able to find a studio or company where I can take classes. I havent danced all summer because of coronavirus and i #8217;m really sad/worried that I won #8217;t be able to dance in France either :/ anyone know what the status is on dance/sports in france right now or how to find a studio there? Thanks!
I went to Marais last time i was in Paris!! Love that studio

I #8217;m in Versailles but idk the town/schools i #8217;ll be in yet. I #8217;m just kind of going nuts because I haven #8217;t danced all summer and I #8217;m a classical ballet dancer, so now i #8217;m feeling super out of practice. I danced with a pro company called Ballet Preljocaj last time i lived in france, but i was in aix en provence. I #8217;m just super afraid I #8217;ll get placed in a super small town with no dance/gyms around

last time i got a french visa it was standard passport size and it was totally fine. the visa center literally had a photo station downstairs and i got mine done there because i forgot to bring mine lol

things i #8217;m glad i brought: a portable phone charger!! essential for when you #8217;re traveling. 1 of your favorite nail polishes and skincare- this stuff can get really expensive in france for some reason. also a small wallet that can fit in your front pocket to avoid pickpocketing, plus a theft resistant backpack (mine has special lock zippers and a pocket against your back for wallet). a scarf that can double as a blanket for travel, airpods, extra chargers for everything, a locker lock for when staying at hostels, cold medicine, a few big ziploc bags for storage. make sure all purses you bring can zip shut. practical shoes for walking really far, and maybe one or two pairs of going out shoes! also sunglasses, regular glasses (if you need them) and copies of ALL of your prescription meds
yep thats what you #8217;re supposed to put! says it in the visa section of the american handbook
yep! on page 14 under line 1g it says to mark current job as student/trainee in the #8220;sector #8221; of teaching. it #8217;s kinda confusing and hard to find so no worries!

last time i got a visa i went to atlanta and their office was a nightmare. they had some sort of incident where someone was smoking drugs or something in the bulding, made us all evacuate in the middle of my appointment, waited outside for FOUR HOURS and finally they came out and were like #8220;lol sorry you #8217;ll have to reschedule. #8221; I had driven five hours there for my appointment and taken off work and had to go back again a few weeks later. absolutely terrible experience lol

WRITING.TITLE: nyc visa hellscape
WRITING.TEXT: Hi guys, this is just a heads up. I went to my visa appointment in nyc today and they refused to let me have my meeting because i havent been quarantined in nyc for 14 days. i spent $1000 traveling for nothing. if you #8217;re from a high risk state coming to nyc they will deny your appointment unless you #8217;ve quarantined there. i even tried to lie and say i #8217;d been in nyc for two weeks but they ask for evidence (flight/hotel/air bnb receipt). also tried explaining that i had been quarantined at my home in sc before coming AND that i had covid two months ago and literally couldn #8217;t get it again yet, but they didn #8217;t care. needless to say if you #8217;re young and poor and need an appointment in nyc you #8217;re fucked. also they didn #8217;t even mention in my confirmation letter/email that the 14 days was required. good luck everyone else lol.
i #8217;m just so angry that those policies weren #8217;t communicated to me beforehand. if they had just said that in their confirmation email i would have planned for it and arrived earlier haha
haggled my way into getting an 8:30am appointment in dc today! fingers crossed everything goes smoothly lol i really cannot afford to deal with any more problems

last time i got a visa i went to atlanta and someone was like smoking meth in one of the bathrooms or something and they made all of us evacuate the building right as i was checking in for my appointment lmao. after waiting outside for HOURS the vfs guy came out and was like #8220;lol sorry reschedule and come back another day #8221; after i had driven six hours and taken off work. you really cannot make this shit up hahahaha
fuckin retweetttttt

update: dc appointment went smoothly! took about 20 mins and was very straightforward. also about getting covid again, i know you can get it twice, but it was just v frustrating because i had proof of a negative test result from like three weeks before :/ idk the whole thing was very expensive and bad. 0/10 stars haha

Thrifting is honestly really big there. They have a pretty big chain called American Vintage ironically with shops all over Paris/elsewhere. Really nice true vintage clothes, but can be a little pricier than second hand stores in the US. Your clothes/style can be a good conversation starter and a way to make friends, so it #8217;s nice to hunt around for unique pieces :)
oooooh yeah! marais definitely has a lot of good thrift stores. if anyone is in the marseille/aix en provence region theres a thrift shop called Blow Up that has a lot of really cool stuff!!
anyone know if coming back to the states for christmas break is a possibility?
